intro: Coccoloba parimensis, commonly known as the Parimeño beauty, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the Bahamas and the Turks and Caicos Islands. This herbaceous perennial has striking, palmately lobed leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the dry season. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or disturbed habitats.
